abstract: Jeffrey L. Bewkes will succeed Richard D. Parsons as the chief executive on Jan. 1, the company announced today, confirming a widely expected transition of power.
snippet: Jeffrey L. Bewkes will succeed Richard D. Parsons as the chief executive on Jan. 1, the company announced today, confirming a widely expected transition of power.
lead_paragraph: Jeffrey L. Bewkes will succeed Richard D. Parsons as the chief executive of Time Warner at the end of the year, the company announced today, confirming a widely expected transition of power at one of the world’s foremost media companies.

headline.main: Parsons to Step Down as Time Warner Chief

abstract: Robert E. Rubin, named chairman of Citigroup, will seek to revive the troubled bank, which said it would take an additional $8 billion to $11 billion write-down.
snippet: Robert E. Rubin, named chairman of Citigroup, will seek to revive the troubled bank, which said it would take an additional $8 billion to $11 billion write-down.
lead_paragraph: Throughout a long, public career, Robert E. Rubin spanned the highest reaches of Wall Street and Washington, and succeeded wherever he went.

abstract: If the Hollywood screenwriters go on strike, the typical American household will not run out of content any time soon. But will the audience return after a lengthy strike?
snippet: If the Hollywood screenwriters go on strike, the typical American household will not run out of content any time soon. But will the audience return after a lengthy strike?
lead_paragraph: In the hierarchy of things the American public seems not to care about — the national debt, Paris Hilton’s charitable works, Fred D. Thompson’s campaign for president — the Hollywood screenwriters’ strike probably wins hands down.

headline.main: New Media, New Value, Old Troubles
headline.print_headline: New Media, New Value, Old Troubles

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: ALLIANCE OF MOTION PICTURE AND TELEVISION PRODUCERS

abstract: Laurence D. Fink may be closer to taking the reins at Merrill Lynch. The securities firm’s board of directors has told Mr. Fink, the chairman of BlackRock, that the top spot is his should he want it, CNBC reported citing unnamed sources.
lead_paragraph: Laurence D. Fink may be closer to taking the reins at Merrill Lynch. The securities firm’s board of directors has told Mr. Fink, the chairman of BlackRock, that the top spot is his should he want it, CNBC reported citing unnamed sources.

headline.main: Merrill Is Said to Favor Fink as New C.E.O.

abstract: Richard D. Parsons is about to have a lot of time on his hands.
lead_paragraph: Richard D. Parsons is about to have a lot of time on his hands.

headline.main: Parsons to Step Down as Time Warner C.E.O. Next January
